title: Bonpara
text:
Bonpara is a "paurashava" (municipal corporation) in <a href="Baraigram%20Upazila">Baraigram Upazila</a> of <a href="Natore%20District">Natore District</a> in north-western <a href="Bangladesh">Bangladesh</a>. It was established in the late 1920s by Christians from Bhawal, a Roman Catholic stronghold to the north of <a href="Dhaka%20District">Dhaka District</a>, and is one of the oldest Christian communities in the country. In 1940 the parish church (dedicated to Our Lady of Lourdes) was consecrated and later St Joseph's High School was instituted.
Sunil Gomes murder.
On 5 June 2016, local Christian Sunil Gomes was hacked to death in Bonpara in an attack claimed by <a href="Islamic%20State%20of%20Iraq%20and%20the%20Levant">Islamic State</a>. Gomes was killed at his grocery store after Sunday prayers at a local church.
